title: Frequency and period - T for two half-pendulums

content.question: A small ball is hung from a string of length <math alttext="3 L sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn><msub><mi>L</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math>, as shown in the figures. There is a small peg just to the left of the string at a distance <math alttext="L sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>L</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> above the center of the ball. The ball is displaced to the left and released from rest, as shown in the middle figure, and moves as a pendulum of length <math alttext="L sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>L</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> until the string is vertical and loses contact with the peg. The ball then continues moving to the right as a pendulum of length <math alttext="3 L sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn><msub><mi>L</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math>, as shown in the right-hand figure, until the string becomes vertical and again contacts the peg. The ball continues moving to the left, again as a pendulum of length <math alttext="L sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>L</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math>, until it returns to its initial release position and completes one oscillation, and then the motion is repeated. What is the period of a complete oscillation for the ball?
